underlying_goal: To investigate the performance and implementation of 'trusted monitors' for sandbagging detection and compare them to other methods.
primary_success: Synthesizing information from disparate sources (code, configs, results files, spec docs) into a single, coherent summary that directly answers the user's questions.
brief_summary: The user requested a detailed report on the 'trusted monitor' detection method. The agent searched source code, configuration files, experiment logs, and result summaries. It successfully compiled a comprehensive overview of the available monitors, their poor detection performance (AUROC ~0.53), and how they compare unfavorably to the C³ method.
